alert.note: Alert for Kanawha (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following county, Kanawha. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from this morning`s rainfall to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 155 PM EDT, Radar and rain gauges indicated between 3 and 6 inches of rain fell this morning. Many creeks and streams will remain elevated through the afternoon and, in some cases, exceeding bankfull. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Lens Creek, Witcher Creek, Campbells Creek, Cabin Creek, Kellys Creek, Dry Branch, Reynolds Branch, and Slaughter Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank and Glasgow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
